en: Study or don't--it's up to you.
zh: 学不学随你。

en: It's a student's business to study.
zh: 学生的本职工作就是学习。

en: It is the role of a student to study.
zh: 学生就要有学生的样子，得好好学习。

en: It is your duty to study.
zh: 学习是你的义务。

en: Don't study.
zh: 别学了。

en: We need a lot of patience when we study.
zh: 学习的时候得有耐心。

en: When I study, I listen to music with earphones.
zh: 我学习的时候习惯戴着耳机听音乐。

en: Whenever you study, use your dictionary to best effect.
zh: 学习的时候一定要把词典用好。

en: It is a student's business to study.
zh: 学生就该好好学习。

en: It remains to be seen whether or not going to America to study is good for me.
zh: 去美国留学到底好不好，现在还不好说。

en: It is no use going to school if you are not going to study.
zh: 要是不打算学习，去学校也没用。

en: Study!
zh: 快去学习！

en: If you don't study, you will fail the exam.
zh: 你要是不学习，考试准得挂。

en: Don't distract me from studying.
zh: 别打扰我学习。

en: She is intense in her study.
zh: 她学习非常刻苦。

en: I need some writing paper.
zh: 我需要几张稿纸。

en: Want me to show you a really useful hidden command?
zh: 想让我给你看个超好用的隐藏命令吗？

en: Some people are anxious to invent convenient things.
zh: 有些人总想发明点方便的东西。

en: Flight number is JL123, on August 23 for Tokyo.
zh: 航班号是JL123，8月23号飞东京。

en: I am constipated.
zh: 我便秘了。

en: It's your duty to care for your parents regardless of the inconvenience.
zh: 不管多不方便，照顾父母都是你的义务。

en: No news is good news. If you haven't heard from your son it's because he's doing well.
zh: 没消息就是好消息，没收到你儿子的信说明他过得挺好的。

en: As she hasn't written to me, I don't know what time she will arrive.
zh: 因为她没给我写信，所以我不知道她什么时候到。

en: I have watery stools.
zh: 我拉肚子了，拉的都是水。

en: No merchandise can be returned.
zh: 商品售出，概不退换。

en: Please credit my account for the returned item.
zh: 请把退货的款项退回到我的账户里。

en: The answer was yes.
zh: 得到的回答是肯定的。

en: I appreciate that you have not had time to write.
zh: 我理解你最近没时间写信。

en: My father told me to write an answer and post it at once.
zh: 我爸让我写个回复赶紧寄出去。

en: I've been upset not having written you a reply.
zh: 一直没给你回信，我心里挺过不去的。

en: It doesn't matter whether you answer or not.
zh: 你回不回复都行。

en: No answer is also an answer.
zh: 不回答也是一种回答。

en: Can't think of an answer?
zh: 想不出怎么回？

en: The least you could do is to answer me.
zh: 你起码得回我一下吧。

en: I'm sorry I didn't get back to you sooner. I've been snowed under at work lately.
zh: 抱歉没能早点回你，最近工作实在太忙了。

en: I'm sorry for the delay in responding.
zh: 不好意思，回晚了。

en: Not having received a reply, he wrote to her again.
zh: 因为一直没收到回复，他又给她写了一封信。

en: Since I didn't receive a reply, I wrote to her again.
zh: 我没收到回复，就又给她写了一次。

en: Not having got a reply, May wrote to Bill again.
zh: 阿美没收到回音，又给比尔写了封信。

en: I want a refund.
zh: 我想退款。

en: Can I change the date of return?
zh: 我能改下回程日期吗？

en: It was quiet all around.
zh: 四周都安安静静的。

en: There was no one about.
zh: 一个人影都没有。

en: The editor and publisher is my cousin.
zh: 那个主编兼发行人是我表哥。

en: The editor glanced over the manuscript.
zh: 编辑扫了一眼稿子。

en: Editors would expect them to be typewritten.
zh: 编辑通常希望稿件是打印出来的。

en: Editors often go to extremes in providing their readers with unimportant facts.
zh: 编辑经常为了给读者提供一些无关紧要的事实而走极端。

en: The editor and the publisher were present at the party.
zh: 编辑和发行人都参加了派对。

en: Dust got into one of my eyes.
zh: 我眼睛里进灰了。

en: One book is thin, and the other is thick.
zh: 一本书很薄，另一本很厚。

en: We have five fingers on each hand.
zh: 每只手都有五个手指头。

en: An odd shoe was left on the doorstep.
zh: 门口丢着一只落单的鞋。

en: There's a lot of mess to clear up.
zh: 有一大堆烂摊子要收拾。

en: If you disguise yourself, they won't be able to tell.
zh: 你变个装，他们就认不出来了。

en: There were many who couldn't recognize him in that disguise.
zh: 很多人都没认出变装后的他。

en: You changed it?
zh: 你改了吗？

en: I was bored with the monotony of daily life.
zh: 我厌倦了这种单调乏味的生活。

en: They like variety; they don't like to stay in just one place.
zh: 他们喜欢新鲜感，不喜欢老待在一个地方。

en: They want change. They hate staying in one place.
zh: 他们想要点变化，讨厌一直待在一个地方。

en: I want change. I hate being in one place for too long.
zh: 我想要点改变，讨厌在一个地方待太久。

en: Quick to adapt to changing circumstances.
zh: 适应环境变化很快。

en: Is everything OK?
zh: 都还好吧？

en: Strange my foot!
zh: 奇怪个屁！

en: You're wearing an odd cap, aren't you?
zh: 你戴的这帽子挺怪的吧？

en: A strange man trespassed on my property.
zh: 有个陌生人闯进了我家。

en: A strange man came up to me and asked for money.
zh: 有个陌生人走过来向我要钱。

en: A strange fish is on the hook.
zh: 钓上来一条长得挺怪的鱼。

en: I feel strange about it.
zh: 我觉得这事儿挺奇怪的。

en: I hear a strange sound.
zh: 我听见有个怪声。

en: Hearing a strange noise, he jumped out of bed.
zh: 听到一声怪响，他一下从床上跳了起来。

en: He heard a strange noise, so he jumped out of bed.
zh: 他听到一声怪响，就从床上跳了下来。

en: That's weird.
zh: 真够怪的。

en: Don't talk rubbish.
zh: 别胡说八道。

en: You should have your head examined.
zh: 你该去看看脑子了。

en: I have a migraine.
zh: 我偏头痛。

en: That's strange.
zh: 真奇怪。

en: We shouldn't have any prejudice.
zh: 我们不该有偏见。

en: It is useless to reason with a bigot.
zh: 跟这种死脑筋的人讲道理没用。

en: Could you wrap this separately, please?
zh: 麻烦帮我分开包装一下。

en: His cottage is on the coast.
zh: 他的小屋在海边。

en: Please bill us separately.
zh: 麻烦帮我们分开结账。

en: I have enclosed your order form.
zh: 我把你的订单随信附上了。

en: The annex is on the north of the original building.
zh: 附属楼在原建筑的北边。

en: The time has come when we must part.
zh: 到了该分别的时候了。

en: It was time to part, but still the couple clung together.
zh: 到了该分别的时候，那对情侣还是依依不舍。

en: I can still see my mother's face.
zh: 我现在还能想起我妈的样子。

en: Show me another example.
zh: 再给我举个例子。

en: Give me another example.
zh: 再给我举个例子。

en: Let's think out another way.
zh: 咱们再想想别的办法。

en: I have another engagement.
zh: 我已经有别的安排了。

en: Please show me another.
zh: 麻烦再给我看个别的。

en: Could you exchange it with another one?
zh: 能给我换一个吗？

en: Could you suggest an alternative date?
zh: 能换个日期吗？

en: He is on another phone.
zh: 他在接另一个电话。

en: I wish I'd married another man.
zh: 我要是嫁给别人就好了。

en: If only I had married another man.
zh: 要是我当初嫁给别人就好了。

en: In another paragraph, he put in a comma.
zh: 在另一段里，他加了个逗号。

en: They will lay another scheme.
zh: 他们会再搞个阴谋。

en: Please show me another example.
zh: 请再给我举个例子。

en: Show me another watch.
zh: 再给我看块别的表。

en: I've found another job.
zh: 我找着新工作了。

en: Let me put it in another way.
zh: 我换个说法吧。

en: On another plan there was the prediction of a new age.
zh: 在另一份计划里，有对新时代的预言。

en: Wait for a second chance.
zh: 等下一次机会吧。

en: Give me a rain-check.
zh: 下次再约。

en: I hope that I will be able to help you at some other time.
zh: 希望下次我能帮到你。

en: I hope that I'll be able to help you at some other time.
zh: 希望下次我能帮到你。

en: I hope I'll be able to help you at some other time.
zh: 希望下次我能帮到你。

en: Could you make it another time?
zh: 能换个时间吗？

en: Show me another bag.
zh: 再给我看个别的包。

en: It may help to look at the problem from another angle.
zh: 换个角度看问题可能会有帮助。

en: We will consider the problem from a different angle.
zh: 我们会从不同的角度来考虑这个问题。

en: Let me buy you another one.
zh: 我再给你买个新的吧。

en: Can I get you another one?
zh: 要我再给你拿一个吗？

en: Could you show me another one, please?
zh: 麻烦再给我看一个。

en: Would you please show me another one?
zh: 能再给我看个别的吗？

en: Would you bring me another one, please?
zh: 麻烦再给我拿一个。

en: I just bought another sweater. Now I have 21!
zh: 我刚又买了一件毛衣，现在我有21件了！

en: Show me another camera.
zh: 再给我看个别的相机。

en: Please show me another camera.
zh: 请再给我看个别的相机。

en: I am not insisting on it. If you don't like it, just don't take it.
zh: 我不强求，你要是不喜欢就算了。

en: There is no need to be frightened. He won't harm you.
zh: 别害怕，他不会伤害你的。

en: I am not alluding to any person in particular.
zh: 我不是在针对谁。

en: The service charge is extra.
zh: 服务费是另算的。

en: I want to buy another.
zh: 我还想再买一个。

en: We're going to paint the wall.
zh: 我们打算刷墙。

en: As soon as you get the wall painted, you can go home.
zh: 墙一刷完你就能回家了。

en: The man painting the wall is my father.
zh: 那个刷墙的人是我爸。

en: The wall is white within and green without.
zh: 这面墙里边是白的，外边是绿的。

en: The fence fell with a great crash.
zh: 篱笆哗啦一声倒了。

en: The walls are hidden by ivy.
zh: 墙被常春藤遮住了。

en: Must I repaint the wall?
zh: 我得把墙重新刷一遍吗？

en: The wall was made of rough stones.
zh: 这面墙是用粗糙的石头砌成的。

en: Look at the notice on the wall.
zh: 看下墙上的通知。

en: Look at the map on the wall carefully.
zh: 仔细看下墙上那张地图。

en: The color of the wall clashes with that of the floor.
zh: 墙的颜色跟地板很不搭。

en: His eye fell on the picture on the wall.
zh: 他的目光落在了墙上的画上。

en: The ballerinas around the walls are stretching their legs and feet so their muscles will not become stiff.
zh: 靠墙的芭蕾舞演员们在拉伸腿脚，免得肌肉僵硬。

en: There were a hat and a coat on the wall.
zh: 墙上挂着一顶帽子和一件外套。

en: There is a map on the wall.
zh: 墙上有一张地图。

en: We tried to make out the letters written on the wall.
zh: 我们试着辨认墙上写的字。

en: Up against the wall!
zh: 靠墙站好！

en: Walls have ears, shouji have eyes.
zh: 隔墙有耳，手机有眼。

en: Walls have ears, sliding paper doors have eyes
zh: 隔墙有耳，纸窗有眼。

en: There is a clock on the wall.
zh: 墙上挂着一个表。

en: The picture on the wall was painted by Picasso.
zh: 墙上那幅画是毕加索画的。

en: There is a picture on the wall.
zh: 墙上有一幅画。

en: There are some pictures on the wall.
zh: 墙上有一些画。

en: His shadow on the wall looked sad.
zh: 他在墙上的影子看着很忧伤。

en: There is a portrait of Bob on the wall.
zh: 墙上有一张鲍勃的画像。

en: The wall was coated with paint.
zh: 墙上刷了一层漆。

en: There is a Picasso on the wall.
zh: 墙上有一幅毕加索的作品。

en: A portrait was hung on the wall.
zh: 墙上挂着一张画像。

en: The walls were hung with some pictures.
zh: 墙上挂着一些画。

en: On the wall there was a big picture of Sir Anthony at the piano.
zh: 墙上有一幅安东尼爵士在弹钢琴的大画像。

en: There are many paintings on the wall.
zh: 墙上挂着很多画。

en: The wall gave way in the earthquake.
zh: 墙在地震中塌了。

en: The walls supported the entire weight of the roof.
zh: 墙承受了房顶的所有重量。

en: The paint was coming off the wall.
zh: 墙上的漆在掉。

en: I have a large library on American literature.
zh: 我有很多关于美国文学的藏书。

en: The rice crop is poor this year.
zh: 今年的水稻收成不好。

en: The rice crop is large this year.
zh: 今年的水稻大丰收。

en: The Fed is trying to stave off a run on the banks.
zh: 美联储正试图制止银行挤兑。

en: The Federal Reserve slashed interest rates.
zh: 美联储大幅下调了利率。

en: In a fight against speculators who are dumping the U.S. currency, central banks of major countries have carried out massive concerted interventions in the market.
zh: 为了打击抛售美元的投机者，各国央行联手对市场进行了大规模干预。

en: The President of the United States is now in Japan.
zh: 美国总统现在在日本。

en: Throughout the United State large numbers of young people enter college every year.
zh: 全美国每年都有大量的年轻人上大学。

en: The U.S. Government made an attempt to open Japan's doors.
zh: 美国政府曾试图打开日本的大门。

en: Americans are said to regard the amount of money a man makes as a criterion of his ability.
zh: 据说美国人把挣多少钱看作衡量一个人能力的准则。

en: Friction between the Americans and the British mounted.
zh: 美英之间的摩擦加剧了。

en: Steering wheels of American cars are on the left side.
zh: 美国车的方向盘在左边。

en: The steering wheels on American cars are on the left side.
zh: 美国车的方向盘都在左边。

en: The United States of America is a democratic country.
zh: 美国是个民主国家。

en: The United States is a democracy.
zh: 美国是个民主政体。

en: The United States is abundant in natural resources.
zh: 美国自然资源很丰富。

en: The United States is typical of the democratic countries.
zh: 美国是典型的民主国家。

en: The affluence of the United States is often contrasted with the poverty of undeveloped countries.
zh: 美国的富裕经常被拿来和欠发达国家的贫穷作对比。

en: The people of America fought for their independence.
zh: 美国人民为了独立而战。

en: Many American parents encourage their sons to play football to keep them away from drugs.
zh: 很多美国父母鼓励儿子打美式橄榄球，好让他们远离毒品。

en: I have been corresponding with a pen pal in the USA for a year.
zh: 我和一个美国笔友通了一年信了。

en: Many races live together in the United States.
zh: 美国有很多种族聚居在一起。

en: They charge tax on liquor in the U.S.
zh: 在美国，买酒是要收税的。

en: NASA says three of 22 space missions that carried generators similar to Galileo's ended in accidents.
zh: 美国航天局说，在22个携带了类似‘伽利略号’发电机的航天任务中，有3个出事了。

en: Rice prices are regulated by the government.
zh: 大米的价格是由政府调控的。

en: Rice grows in warm countries.
zh: 水稻生长在气候温暖的国家。

en: Rice grows in warm climates.
zh: 水稻在温暖的气候中生长。

en: Rice is grown in many parts of the world.
zh: 世界很多地方都种大米。

en: Rice is one of those staple commodities.
zh: 大米是主要的大宗商品之一。

en: Rice will find a ready market there.
zh: 大米在那儿会很有销路。

en: Rice is sold by the kilogram.
zh: 大米是按公斤卖的。

en: Rice is the chief crop in this area.
zh: 大米是这个地区的主要农作物。

en: The price of rice is going up again.
zh: 米价又要涨了。

en: The price of rice has come down.
zh: 米价降下来了。

en: The price of rice rose by three percent.
zh: 米价上涨了百分之三。

en: The price of rice went up three percent.
zh: 米价上调了百分之三。

en: Production of rice has decreased.
zh: 大米的产量下降了。

en: A poor rice harvest will get us into real trouble.
zh: 大米欠收会让我们陷入大麻烦。

en: The price of rice rose by more than three percent.
zh: 米价涨了百分之三以上。

en: The meeting was closed.
zh: 会议结束了。

en: A fly does not fly into a shut mouth.
zh: 苍蝇飞不进闭上的嘴巴。

en: Wait in line, please.
zh: 请排队等候。

en: Don't speak out of line.
zh: 别乱说话。

en: We specialize in the import of machinery parts.
zh: 我们专门从事机械零件的进口业务。

en: Allow us to describe our products and our business operations.
zh: 请允许我们介绍一下公司的产品和业务。

en: Enclosed is our company profile.
zh: 附件里有我们公司的简介。

en: Our engineers compared this information with similar products being sold in Japan and concluded that they might compete very well.
zh: 我们的工程师把这些信息跟日本卖的同类产品做了比较，认为我们的产品非常有竞争力。

en: I hope this letter interests you and look forward to your reply.
zh: 希望您对这封信感兴趣，期待您的回信。

en: Thank you for your interest in our company.
zh: 感谢您对我们公司的关注。

en: She got her feet wet teaching while she was in the Peace Corps.
zh: 她在和平队期间就开始尝试教书并积累经验了。

en: The peace talks begin this week.
zh: 和谈这周开始。

en: There is no one but desires peace.
zh: 没有人不渴望和平。

en: There is no one who doesn't desire peace.
zh: 每个人都希望和平。

en: There is no man but desires peace.
zh: 只要是人，就没有不向往和平的。

en: There are no people who don't desire peace.
zh: 没有人不向往和平。

en: How much we still have to pay for peace is a riddle.
zh: 为了和平我们还要付出多少代价，还是个谜。

en: Nothing is as important as peace.
zh: 没有什么比和平更重要了。

en: Peace will come to us in time.
zh: 和平迟早会到来的。

en: Peace is of great importance.
zh: 和平至关重要。

en: The obverse of peace is war.
zh: 和平的反面就是战争。

en: The opposite of peace is war.
zh: 和平的对立面是战争。

en: Happy is a man who lives in peace and content.
zh: 生活在安宁和满足中的人是幸福的。

en: They are moving from the peaceful hills and the countryside to the busy world of streets and crowds.
zh: 他们正从宁静的乡村搬往熙熙攘攘的大都市。

en: Who doesn't hope for peace and security?
zh: 谁不希望能平安、安全呢？

en: There is no one but longs for peace and security.
zh: 每个人都渴望和平与安全。

en: They had a long talk in an atmosphere of peace and freedom.
zh: 他们在和平自由的氛围中长谈了一番。

en: Nothing but peace can save the world.
zh: 只有和平才能拯救世界。

en: The waterways ramify across the plain.
zh: 水路在平原上纵横交错。

en: The waterways branch out across the plain.
zh: 水道在平原上四处延展开来。

en: Mr Hirano is looked up to as an excellent engineer.
zh: 平野先生是一位备受尊敬的优秀工程师。

en: My temperature is normal.
zh: 我的体温很正常。

en: You have to pay 10,000 yen extra on holidays.
zh: 节假日得额外多付一万日元。

en: It seems less crowded during the week.
zh: 周中人好像没那么挤。

en: Equality is guaranteed by the Constitution.
zh: 宪法保障人人平等。

en: Thank you very much for patronizing our store for a long time.
zh: 非常感谢您长期以来对本店的光顾。

en: You will lose your position if you don't keep your temper.
zh: 你要是控制不住脾气，职位就不保了。

en: Business as usual.
zh: 照常营业。

en: Mr Hirayama is a very good teacher.
zh: 平山老师是个特别好的老师。

en: Mr. Hirayama is a very good teacher.
zh: 平山老师是个特别好的老师。

en: Mr Hirayama teaches very well.

en: Slide down the hill while distributing your weight equally on both skis.
zh: 把重心平均分配在两块滑雪板上，然后滑下坡去。

en: The average length is seven hours and forty-five minutes, not much different from what a lot of humans need.
zh: 平均时长是七小时四十五分钟，和很多人的睡眠需求差不多。

en: She is almost as intelligent as an average human child.

en: The average temperature has gone up.

en: On an average how many miles do you walk a day?

en: On an average, I go to the movies twice a month.
zh: 我平均一个月看两次电影。

en: I'm cool with that.
zh: 我没意见。

en: I can swim on my front but not on my back.
zh: 我会正着游，但不会仰泳。

en: Try to write in plain English.
zh: 尽量用简单的英语写。

en: Written in plain English, this book is easy to read.
zh: 这本书是用简单的英语写的，读起来很容易。

en: Written in plain English, the book is suitable for beginners.
zh: 这本书是用简单的英语写的，适合初学者。

en: Written as it is in plain English, this book is useful to beginners.
zh: 因为是用简单的英语写的，这本书对初学者很有帮助。

en: Flat land has no mountains or hills.
zh: 平地上没有大山小坡。

en: Take the pan off the fire.
zh: 把锅从火上拿开。

en: There was broken glass on top of the wall.

en: The apples on the other side of the wall are the sweetest.
zh: 墙那边的苹果才是最甜的。

en: Don't climb up the wall.
zh: 别爬墙。

en: Don't throw a ball against the wall.
zh: 别往墙上扔球。

en: Hillary rested the ladder against the wall.
zh: 希拉里把梯子靠在了墙上。

en: The soldiers were all supplied with a map of the place.
zh: 士兵们都领到了一份当地的地图。

en: The soldier kept a sharp lookout in the darkness.

en: The soldiers were marching with their swords shining.
zh: 士兵们行军时，佩剑闪闪发光。

en: The soldiers were told never to surrender.
zh: 士兵们接到命令，绝不投降。

en: The soldiers proceeded to the frontier with caution.
zh: 士兵们小心翼翼地向边境进发。

en: Soldiers are used to danger.

en: All the soldiers stood side by side.
zh: 士兵们都并肩站着。

en: I have got into Hyogo University.
zh: 我考上兵库大学了。

en: I go to Hyogo University.
zh: 我在兵库大学上学。

en: What is the population of Hyogo prefecture?

en: The only sound to be heard was the ticking of the clock.

en: Talk louder so that I may hear you.

en: I can't hear you.

en: Can you hear me?

en: Do you read me?

en: I can't hear it.

en: The more I hear, the more interesting it becomes.

en: Nothing is lost for asking.

en: I'm all ears.

en: Want to know?

en: I need to hear it.

en: I am tired of hearing that.

en: Don't ask.

en: Please don't ask.

en: Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard are sweeter.

en: Do you hear me?

en: Are you listening?

en: You know what?

en: The price rose.
zh: 价格涨了。

en: Prices went up.
zh: 涨价了。

en: The cost of living has risen.
zh: 生活费涨了。

en: The cost of living has gone up.
zh: 物价涨了。

en: Many wives complain about high prices.
zh: 很多主妇都抱怨物价高。

en: There are many housewives who complain about high prices.
zh: 有很多主妇都抱怨物价太贵。

en: The prices have gone down.
zh: 降价了。

en: Prices have gone down.
zh: 物价降了。

en: The cost of living has gone down.
zh: 生活成本降了。

en: Prices have jumped.
zh: 物价猛涨。

en: The prices will come down.
zh: 物价会降下来的。

en: Prices are about to go up again.
zh: 物价又要涨了。

en: It is said that prices are going to rise again.
zh: 听说物价又要涨了。

en: Prices have been climbing steadily.
zh: 物价一直在稳步上涨。

en: It amazed us to hear that things were so cheap.
zh: 听说东西那么便宜，我们都惊呆了。

en: With prices so high, I will do without a new suit this year.
zh: 物价这么高，我今年就不买新西装了。

en: Not a sound was heard.
zh: 一点声音也没有。

en: A noise woke her up.
zh: 响声把她吵醒了。

en: I fancied that I heard a noise.
zh: 我刚才好像听到有什么动静。

en: I fancy that I heard a noise.
zh: 我好像听到有什么动静。

en: There is enough light to read by.
zh: 光线够看书了。

en: The sight memory organ is below the hypothalamus.
zh: 视觉记忆器官在下丘脑下面。

en: When it comes to making things, I'm all thumbs.
zh: 说到动手做东西，我笨手笨脚的。

en: Beggars can't be choosers.
zh: 要饭的没得挑。

en: I gave it a try figuring that anything is worth a try. But putting together a program like this is something I'm no match for.
zh: 我想着凡事都值得一试，就试了下，但搞这种项目我实在搞不定。

en: There is a time for all things.
zh: 凡事都有时候。

en: You can get anything less expensive in bulk.
zh: 批量买东西会便宜点。

en: Everything has its limit.
zh: 凡事都有个度。

en: I see double.
zh: 我看东西重影。

en: I can't see well.
zh: 我看不清。

en: Buddhism had its beginnings in India.
zh: 佛教起源于印度。

en: Buddhism was introduced into Japan in 538.
zh: 佛教是在538年传到日本的。

en: Is it difficult to act according to Buddhist principles?
zh: 按佛理行事难吗？

en: The article on Buddhism revived my interest in Oriental religions.
zh: 那篇关于佛教的文章重新激起了我对东方宗教的兴趣。

en: The article on Buddhism revived my passion for Oriental religions.
zh: 那篇关于佛教的文章重新激起了我对东方宗教的热情。

en: You can only go so far.
zh: 做事要适可而止。

en: Put some salt into the boiling water.
zh: 往开水里放点盐。

en: Let me pick up the check.
zh: 我来买单吧。

en: Let me pay.
zh: 我来付钱。

en: Please let me pay.
zh: 让我来付吧。

en: I'm not sure I can afford it.
zh: 我不确定我买不买得起。

en: If I had money enough, I could pay you.
zh: 如果我有足够的钱，我就能还你钱了。

en: For a refund, you must return the item unopened.
zh: 要退款的话，包装不能拆。

en: How do I get reimbursed?
zh: 我该怎么报销？

en: I'd like to get a refund.
zh: 我想退款。

en: Let's split the bill.
zh: 我们AA吧。

en: Masked men held up the passengers and robbed them of their money.
zh: 蒙面人拦住了乘客并抢走了他们的钱。

en: Weakness brought on by a number of respiratory ailments had forced him just last week to announce that he was giving up his conducting career.
zh: 由于多种呼吸道疾病导致身体虚弱，他上周不得不宣布结束指挥生涯。

en: We've run out of paper for the photocopier.
zh: 复印机没纸了。

en: Do you know anything about complex carbohydrates?
zh: 你了解复合碳水化合物吗？

en: The pain from the compound fracture was almost intolerable.
zh: 复合骨折的疼痛几乎让人无法忍受。
